news.title: How to build a user feedback loop into your web3 dapp
news.subtitle: Build a user feedback form into your web3 dapp.

image.title: How to build a user feedback loop into your web3 dapp image

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Collecting user feedback is one of the most critical steps to achieving product-market-fit and creating a successful application. And itâ€™s even more important in web3, where standards for UX design are still emerging and undefined.

For web3 developers, the most popular method of collecting user feedback about their dapps continues to be centralized solutions offered by companies like Google and Mailchimp. However, on-chain feedback forms are now available. Letâ€™s look at these web3-native feedback forms, why theyâ€™re important to your dappâ€™s success, and how to use them.

In a previous post, we introduced Form-xChange: a new open-source, decentralized web3 form built by Consensys, and showed you how to integrate it into your dapp using the MetaMask SDK.

In this tutorial, weâ€™ll build on these steps by showing you how to deploy a feedback form to your frontend and create a new form for users to share their input about your dapp. But first, a quick reminder on the importance of collecting user feedback for product development and management.

Web3 user feedback forms to help mass adoption


Native, decentralized feedback forms are desperately needed in web3. Why?

  1. They cut costs dramatically: The only (and one-time) cost associated with creating a form is during the deployment of a smart contract. And if deployed on an L2 like Linea, the cost is usually not more than a few dollars.
  2. They have near-infinite customization possibilities: You can design your form to collect any kind of feedback you wish (text, reactions, links, etc.). Additionally, you can customize your frontend as needed as it is completely distinct from the contract.
  3. You pay only for what you use: With decentralized forms, there are no payment tiers based on the number of responses. Theoretically, you can record as many responses as you want. \

If youâ€™re adopting a model where customers pay gas, you wonâ€™t incur any cost beyond contract deployment.
If you choose to pay the bill on behalf of your customers, again the cost is a few cents when youâ€™re operating on a cost-efficient network. 4. You can implement token gating: Using decentralized forms, you can gate access to who can respond to your form questions. Therefore, you could theoretically limit access to wallets who own NFTs from your collection, wallets that have a certain non-zero balance of ETH, or an ERC-20 token of your choice.

A tutorial: creating your own decentralized user feedback form


Step 1: Install MetaMask


We will be deploying and interacting with our contracts on Linea. In order to do this, we will require a crypto wallet that is configured with the Linea network and has a small balance of LineaETH.

You first need a web3 wallet. In this tutorial weâ€™ll use MetaMask â€” a free, easy to use wallet that comes automatically configured with Linea. You can install MetaMask as an extension for your browser here.

Note: For this tutorial, we recommend using a browser other than Brave (for example, Edge, Chrome, Safari, etc.). At the time of writing, Form-xChange has known issues running on the Brave browser.

Once youâ€™ve added the extension, MetaMask will prompt you to complete a series of steps, including giving you your wallet recovery phrase. Store this phrase carefully. If lost, you canâ€™t recover it. If stolen, someone else will have access to your funds.

Once your wallet is set up, navigate to the network drop-down in the top left of the MetaMask extension and toggle show test networks on. From the new drop-down, select the Linea Goerli network. If all goes well, your wallet should look something like this:

Step 2: Acquire LineaETH from a faucet

If this is your first time working with Linea, your wallet will (obviously) have a balance of 0 LineaETH.

Letâ€™s change that. Infura has a faucet that gives you access to free 0.5 LineaETH every day. In order to access this faucet, you may be prompted to create a free Infura account.

Once the top up is done, you should see a small LineaETH balance:

Step 3: Acquire a Linea RPC endpoint


Sign into Infura again using the account you created in the previous step. You will automatically be redirected to the main dashboard.

Here, create a new project by creating a new API key on the top right.

For network, choose web3 API. You can name the key anything you want.

Once your key is created, you will be redirected once again to a project dashboard containing a collection of endpoints. From here, take note of the endpoint associated with Linea testnet. We will require this in a later step to deploy our Form-xChange contracts.

Step 4: Install node and npm


The Form-xChange solution runs on a stack of Infura, Next.js, Truffle, and the Dapp API. In order to install and use these technologies, weâ€™ll need node and npm on our local machine.

You can download both for your operating system here.

Once done, check that it has been installed correctly by checking their version numbers on your terminal.

$ node -v
$ npm -v

Step 5: Clone the Form-xChange repository

As mentioned earlier, Form-xChange is an open-source repository whose source code is publicly available on GitHub.

Letâ€™s clone this repository and install all required packages using the following commands:

$ git clone https://github.com/Consensys/Form-XChange
$ cd Form-XChange
$ npm install

Open the Form-xChange repository in your favorite code editor (e.g. VS Code). This is a turn-key project, so we wonâ€™t need to write much code apart from configuring a few environment variables.

Step 6: Deploy the feedback form


Navigate to the sub-folder containing the Truffle project and the form smart contracts:

$ cd packages/form-XChange

In this folder, you will see a contracts sub-folder that contains two main contracts: a FeedbackForm and a FeedbackFormFactory.

The former implements an individual form that is capable of storing a list of questions and responses made to those questions.

The latter is a factory contract that can be used to deploy customized versions of the former.

You can take a look at the source code and make modifications according to the kind of form that you want to create. For this tutorial, weâ€™ll stick to the default configuration.

In this step, we are going to deploy the FeedbackFormFactory contract. This will allow us, the creator, to create forms from our Next frontend.

In order to do this, create a file named .env and add the following information:

MNEMONIC = "< YOUR WALLET RECOVERY PHRASE >"

Next, in the truffle-config.js file, replace the generic RPC endpoint with the Infura endpoint you generated in Step 3. The final config file should look something like this:

require("dotenv").config();
const mnemonic = process.env["MNEMONIC"];

const HDWalletProvider = require("@truffle/hdwallet-provider");

module.exports = {
  networks: {
    development: {
      host: "127.0.0.1", // Localhost
      port: 9545,
      network_id: "5777",
      chain_id: 1337,
    },
    linea: {
      provider: () =>
        new HDWalletProvider(mnemonic, `< INFURA LINEA ENDPOINT >`),
      network_id: 59140,
      chain_id: 59140,
    },
  },
  mocha: {
    timeout: 100000,
  },
  compilers: {
    solc: {
      version: "0.8.13",
    },
  },
};

Weâ€™re all set! Deploy the feedback form factory contract by running the following command:

$ npm run linea

If all goes well you should see output that looks something like this:

> form-xchange@0.0.0 linea
> npm run compile && npm run generate-types && npm run migrate:linea

> form-xchange@0.0.0 compile
> truffle compile

Compiling your contracts...
===========================
> Everything is up to date, there is nothing to compile.

> form-xchange@0.0.0 generate-types
> typechain --target=truffle-v5 'build/contracts/*.json'

Successfully generated 5 typings!

> form-xchange@0.0.0 migrate:linea
> truffle migrate --network linea

Compiling your contracts...
===========================
> Everything is up to date, there is nothing to compile.

Starting migrations...
======================
> Network name:    'linea'
> Network id:      59140
> Block gas limit: 61000000 (0x3a2c940)

1_deploy_contracts.js
=====================

   Replacing 'FeedbackFormFactory'
   -------------------------------
   > transaction hash:    0x50ba2c362cb463d0b763ba5f092e3f1a8591dd9cd358f2feda035438ce02cee0
   > Blocks: 2            Seconds: 21
   > contract address:    0xBDAb1F857dC80968022784cc1C868820BFD2F7c5
   > block number:        1099121
   > block timestamp:     1688991002
   > account:             0xc361Fc33b99F88612257ac8cC2d852A5CEe0E217
   > balance:             0.62878173171592041
   > gas used:            2636875 (0x283c4b)
   > gas price:           2.500000007 gwei
   > value sent:          0 ETH
   > total cost:          0.006592187518458125 ETH

   > Saving artifacts
   -------------------------------------
   > Total cost:     0.006592187518458125 ETH

Summary
=======
> Total deployments:   1
> Final cost:          0.006592187518458125 ETH

Take note of the contract address. Weâ€™ll need this in a later step.

Step 7: Deploy the Next frontend factory

With our feedback form factory contract live, letâ€™s shift our attention to the Next frontend. Navigate to the Next app project by running the following command:

$ cd ../../apps/web

Weâ€™ll need to connect our app with the contract we deployed in the previous step. We can do so by opening the lib/contract.ts/config.ts file and adding the contract address.

export const FEEDBACK_FACTORY_CONTRACT_ADDRESS = "< FEEDBACK FORM FACTORY CONTRACT ADDRESS >";

In the apps/web folder, create another .env file and this time, add the Infura key associated with your project from Step 3.

INFURA_KEY=< YOUR INFURA API KEY >

Weâ€™re all set! Letâ€™s now deploy the app to localhost:

$ npm run dev

You can now check out the app on localhost:3000. It should look something like this:

Letâ€™s go ahead and create a new form!

Connect your MetaMask wallet using the functionality available in the top-right corner of the app. Once this is done, the app automatically recognizes that you were the one who deployed the factory contract and hence, you are the creator of the app too.

This will allow you to create new forms from the UI here.

Add a form title, description, and at least one question, and click on Create Form.

This will prompt MetaMask to approve a transaction. Remember that youâ€™re being asked to do this because creation of a form effectively means the creation of a new FeedbackForm contract.

Head back to the home page, and you should see your form there. You can now submit responses on your form!

Note that you will be required to pay a small amount of gas in order to record this response (via MetaMask).

Keep building with the web3 stack: Infura, Linea, and MetaMask

And there you have it! Without writing almost any code, we have deployed an entire decentralized form solution for our dapp and gained the ability to not just capture user feedback, but to capture it in a decentralized, web3-native form. Projects like Form-xChange will be a big step towards bringing web2 UX design to web3 applications. Feel free to modify the look and feel of your Next frontend as well as the functionality offered by the smart contracts. You are free (and in fact, encouraged) to make this your own.

nodes.title: How to sell crypto
nodes.subtitle: Turn your crypto to cash. In a flash.

image.title: How to sell crypto with MetaMask
image.description: MetaMask makes selling cryptocurrencies fast, easy, and secure. With low fees and seamless off-ramping.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Selling crypto for cash is as simple as can be with MetaMask. You can exchange crypto from MetaMask wallet directly to your debit card, credit card, PayPal, or bank account. No unnecessary steps, no excess fees, no worries.

Below, we'll give you an overview of how we make MetaMask wallet powerful, secure, and configurable when you sell cryptocurrencies. Then, you'll find videos and step-by-step guides showing you how to sell crypto with MetaMask on your browser or mobile app.

Let's get into it! ðŸ¦Š

How MetaMask empowers you

  • Sell directly from your MetaMask wallet, and send cash to the place that works for you.
  • Choose the best quote from our industry-leading aggregator.
  • Avoid centralized exchanges, extra steps, and additional costs.
  • Use MetaMask wallet in 188 countries with over 80 currencies available.
  • Buy crypto, use crypto, and sell crypto. All in one place.

How MetaMask keeps you secure

  • Get 24/7 help whenever you need it from our expert customer service team.
  • We only work with trusted providers, ensuring that they comply with applicable regulations and are legitimate, responsible parties.
  • Preserving your privacy is paramount: MetaMask does not store â€” nor do we have access to â€” any personal information you provide when buying or selling crypto, such as payment details, personal data, or email addresses.
  • Unlike a centralized exchange, neither MetaMask nor our partners have access to the cryptocurrencies after you purchase or transfer them, meaning you can access your assets immediately without a holding period.

How MetaMask gives you choice

  • Choose your preferred destination for your cash including: debit card, credit card, bank transfer, and PayPal.
  • Select your preferred quote and provider.
  • Sell crypto using MetaMask Extension on desktop or the MetaMask app on mobile.

Sell crypto with MetaMask Extension

Click the Buy & Sell button on MetaMask extension to redirect to MetaMask Portfolio. Once there, connect your MetaMask wallet.

  1. Click Move crypto.
  2. Click Sell.
  3. Select your region, and currency â€” located to the right of your wallet address.
  4. Enter the amount of crypto that you want to sell. Example: 0.5 ETH.
  5. Select the account destination you want. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal balance. Availability will depend on your region.
  6. Select the best real-time quote from our industry-leading providers. You'll be securely redirected to the providerâ€™s website where you may have to share KYC, then directed back to MetaMask Portfolio once you accept the quote.
  7. Upon returning to MetaMask Portfolio click Send ETH.
  8. Click Confirm to complete the transaction in your MetaMask wallet.

Note: You can click on Sell to keep track of your order as it is processed. Times may vary depending on provider.

Success! ðŸ¦Š

Sell crypto with MetaMask app

  1. Sign-in to your MetaMask app.
  2. Tap on the menu buttonâ€š which has two arrows in opposite directions and is located on the bottom of your homepage screen.
  3. Tap Sell.
  4. Select your region and currency â€” located to the right of your wallet address.
  5. Enter the crypto amount you want to sell. Example: 0.5 ETH.
  6. Tap Send your cash to and select the account destination you want. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal. Availability will depend on your region.
  7. Tap Get quotes to proceed.
  8. Select the best quote from our industry-leading providers. You'll be securely redirected to the providerâ€™s portal, where you may have to share KYC, then directed back to MetaMask app once you accept the quote.
  9. Review the order summary in your MetaMask app, and tap Confirm to complete the transaction.

Note: You can tap on progress notification to keep track of your order as it is processed. Times may vary depending on provider.

Success! ðŸ¦Š

Ready to get started? If youâ€™re on desktop, download MetaMask Extension. If youâ€™re on mobile, download MetaMask app in the Apple Store or Google Store.

Need more help? We got you. Head to MetaMask Support to speak with our team of experts around-the-clock.

nodes.metaDescription: Sell crypto for cash directly to your debit card, credit card, PayPal, or bank account with MetaMask wallet.

nodes.title: How to buy crypto
nodes.subtitle: Go from cash to crypto. All in one place.

image.title: How to buy crypto
image.description: Explore the ways MetaMask makes buying crypto speedy, simple, and secure.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Wondering how to buy crypto, but not sure where to start? Youâ€™ve come to the right place. Buying crypto with MetaMask is swift, seamless, and safe. You can use methods like a credit card, debit card, bank account, Apple Pay, Google Pay, or PayPal. No need for centralized exchanges. Weâ€™ve cut out all of the unnecessary steps â€” saving you time, and money on excess fees too.

Below, we'll give you an overview of how we make MetaMask wallet powerful, secure, and configurable when you buy cryptocurrencies. Then, you'll find videos and step-by-step guides showing you exactly how to buy crypto with MetaMask on your browser or mobile app.

Let's get into it! ðŸ¦Š

How MetaMask empowers you

  • Buy crypto straight into your MetaMask wallet.
  • Choose the best quote from our industry-leading aggregator.
  • Avoid centralized exchanges, extra steps, and additional costs.
  • Use MetaMask wallet in 188 countries with over 80 currencies available.
  • Select from hundreds of your favorite tokens across 15+ networks including: Ethereum, Linea, Optimism, BNB Chain, Polygon, zkSync, Base, Arbitrum, and Avalanche.
  • Go from cash to crypto back to cash. All in one place.

How MetaMask keeps you secure

  • Get 24/7 help whenever you need it from our expert customer service team.
  • We only work with trusted providers, ensuring that they comply with applicable regulations and are legitimate, responsible parties.
  • Preserving your privacy is paramount: MetaMask does not store â€” nor do we have access to â€” any personal information you provide when buying or selling crypto, such as payment details, personal data, or email addresses.
  • Unlike a centralized exchange, neither MetaMask nor our partners have access to the cryptocurrencies after you purchase or transfer them, meaning you can access your assets immediately without a holding period.

How MetaMask gives you choice

  • Choose your preferred way to buy crypto: debit card, credit card, bank transfer, instant ACH, PayPal, Apple Pay, Google Pay, Ideal, SEPA bank transfers, and alternative local payment methods. These are subject to availability based on your region.
  • Select your preferred quote and provider.
  • Using MetaMask Extension on desktop or the MetaMask app on mobile.

Buy crypto with MetaMask Extension

Clicking the Buy & Sell button on the MetaMask extension will redirect you to MetaMask Portfolio. Once there, connect your MetaMask wallet.

  1. Click Move crypto.
  2. Click Buy.
  3. Select your region, and currency â€” located to the right of your wallet address.
  4. Select the payment method you want to use to buy crypto. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal balance. Availability will depend on your region.
  5. Select the crypto token and network that you want to buy on. Example: ETH on Ethereum.
  6. Enter the amount you want to buy. Example: 0.5 ETH Example: $100 of ETH.
  7. Select the best real-time quote from our industry-leading providers.
  8. You'll be securely redirected to the provider's website to complete the purchase, and funds will be deposited into your MetaMask wallet.

Success! ðŸ¦Š

Buy crypto with MetaMask mobile app

  1. Sign-in to your MetaMask app.
  2. Tap the menu button, which has two arrows in opposite directions and is located on the bottom of your homepage screen.
  3. Tap Buy
  4. Select your region and currency â€” located to the right of your wallet address.
  5. Select the crypto token and network that you want to buy on. Example: ETH on Ethereum.
  6. Enter the amount you want to buy. Example: 0.5 ETH.
  7. Select the payment method you want to use to buy crypto. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal balance. Availability will depend on your region.
  8. Tap Get quotes to proceed. Select the best quote from our industry-leading providers.
  9. Complete the transaction on the providerâ€™s portal, and link your desired payment method.
  10. Review the order summary in your MetaMask app, and confirm the transaction to get crypto in your wallet.

Success! ðŸ¦Š

Ready to get started? If youâ€™re on desktop, download MetaMask Extension. If youâ€™re on mobile, download MetaMask app for iOS or Android.

Need more help? We got you. Head to MetaMask Support to speak with our team of experts around-the-clock.

nodes.metaDescription: Explore the ways to buy crypto directly using your debit card, credit card, PayPal, and bank account with MetaMask wallet.

nodes.title: Transfers from Coinbase and Binance now available in MetaMask
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask launches new CEX transfer feature to make your wallet more powerful.

image.title: Centralized exchange transfers MetaMask now available
image.description: Centralized exchange transfers from Coinbase and Binance now available on MetaMask.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
MetaMask Portfolio now supports centralized exchange (CEX) transfers from Coinbase and Binance, streamlining the process of transferring assets to your crypto wallet.

Many web3 users have digital assets divided across multiple wallets and accounts, creating a fragmented experience. Moving assets from one platform to another can be overly complicated and involve many stepsâ€”fraught with the risks of copying and pasting addresses incorrectly, and potential security concerns. MetaMaskâ€™s new CEX transfer feature is a solution to this issue, making your wallet more powerful, while also strengthening security.

Instant transfer of assets from centralized exchanges into your MetaMask wallet

MetaMask CEX transfers allow you to immediately move assets between accounts, eliminating the need for manually entering addresses. And, if you have bank accounts linked to your Coinbase or Binance accounts, purchasing crypto directly with your bank account to your MetaMask wallet has never been easier. No additional KYC necessary.

In April 2024, MetaMask partnered with Meld and Mesh to launch a feature that allowed users to track external CEX balances by linking Coinbase or Binance accounts directly from the MetaMask Portfolio dashboard. Now, you can view CEX balances, and also transfer assets from these exchanges into your MetaMask wallet. Neither MetaMask, nor our partners in this integration, will ever have access to your exchange login credentials, or share your wallet addresses with third parties.

CEX transfers will initially support Coinbase or Binance accounts, with expansion to additional exchanges on the horizon. No fees will be charged when transferring digital assets from exchanges to MetaMask. A nominal transaction fee of 0.25% will be applied when transferring from MetaMask to centralized exchanges. Network gas fees also apply.

By bridging the gap between self-custodial and centralized platforms, MetaMask is paving the way for a more powerful, integrated, and user-friendly DeFi ecosystem. Head to MetaMask Portfolio today to get started with CEX transfers.

nodes.metaDescription: MetaMask launches new CEX transfer feature to make your wallet more powerful.
